interpolation package

Submodules

interpolation.bilinear_interp module

interpolation.bilinear_interp.bilinear_interpolation(x_points: ndarray, y_points: ndarray, values: ndarray, x: ndarray, y: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Bilinear interpolation for points (x,y) on a rectangular grid.

Computes weighted sum of values at four corners using bilinear interpolation formula.

Parameters:

  • x_points – Array of shape (2,) with x-coordinates of corners.

  • y_points – Array of shape (2,) with y-coordinates of corners.

  • values – Array of values at corners.

  • x – X-coordinates of points to interpolate.

  • y – Y-coordinates of points to interpolate.

Returns:

Interpolated values for points (x, y). The output shape matches the input shapes of x and y.

Return type:

np.array

Raises:

AssertionError –

  • x_points or y_points don’t have shape (2,) - x_points or y_points contain identical values

interpolation.console module

interpolation.image_process module

interpolation.image_process.process_interpolation(source: pathlib.Path, output: pathlib.Path, width: int, height: int) → pathlib.Path[source]

Resize an image using bilinear interpolation and save the result.

Parameters:

  • source – Path to the source image file.

  • output – Path where the resized image will be saved.

  • width – Target width in pixels for the output image.

  • height – Target height in pixels for the output image.

Returns:

Path to the saved output image.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If the source image cannot be loaded or is invalid.

  • IOError – If the output file cannot be written.
